Class ec.evm$.Root 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.evm$.Root
public class Root
extends Object
implements Tether
A Root is a tether whose target is inside a Vat owned by this objectspace. There is no external way to create a Root--they are created as a consequence of passing a message through a Leaf. Roots, as the name implies, are roots for EGC.

Root(StandardVat, Object)
Create a Root.

finalize()
Override of method in java.lang.Object.
invoke(Method, Object[])
Implementation of method from ec.util.Tether.
invoke(Method, Object[], Result)
Implementation of method from ec.util.Tether.

Root 
 public Root(StandardVat theVat,
             Object theTarget)
Create a Root.

Parameters:
theVat - the vat that this Root points into
theTarget - the target object that this Root points at

finalize 
 protected void finalize()
Override of method in java.lang.Object. In this case, when a Root is finalized, it decreases the vat's rootTable's ref-count for it and removes the target from the rootTable if the ref-count reaches 0.

Overrides:
finalize in class Object
